page.title: 03CHILD EMPLOYMENT
page.content: There is a custom at the GOLF CLUB of employing caddies to carry round sets of CLUBS for the players.The CADDY is often a schoolboy who works for the CADDY MASTER at the course,and is a way for them to earn extra spending money. The player asks the Caddy Master for a caddy and pays him around Â£3.60,of that the caddy will get Â£2.70,the rest goes to the club.The boys usually only cover one round of Golf a day but sometimes they are given a TIP and even bought a drink. The boys job is to hand the player the club he needs,carry the set around the course,look for any missing balls and to rescue them from streams and sandpits.A new trend has developed-wealthier players now use ELECTRICALLY POWERED TROLLIES-caddies could soon be extinct.
